document.docAuthor: Dardón, María José, Torres, Félix & Ornosa, Concepción
document.masterDocTitle: The subgenus Andrena (Micrandrena) (Hymenoptera: Andrenidae) in the Iberian Peninsula

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The subgenus Andrena (Micrandrena) (Hymenoptera: Andrenidae) in the Iberian Peninsula

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Andrena spreta
Pérez 1895
: 43
( Paratype examined)
Andrena curtula
Pérez 1903
: 85
( Lectotype examined)
? Andrena lampronota
Pérez 1911
: 41

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Individuals of this species are recognized by the characteristic microsculpture of the T, which could be defined as strong, rough, and intermingled with PPs. The marginal zones are clearly marked. The males are characterized by the strong microsculpture of the marginal zones, which is stronger than in the discs. A 3 and A 4 are short. The species is bivoltine and shows some dimorphism.

bibRefCitation.author: Perez
bibRefCitation.refString: Perez, J. (1895) Especes Nouvelles de Melliferes de Barbarie (Diagnoses preliminaires). Bordeaux, 45, 1 - 64.
